    Predictive Metrics

    predictive-metrics.Rmd
    library(risk3r)
    N <- 10000

predicted <- runif(N)

actual <- rbinom(N, size = 1, prob = predicted)

metrics(actual, predicted)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>      ks   auc    iv  gini
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
<<<<<<< Updated upstream
#> 1 0.505 0.833  1.73 0.665
    ======= #> 1 0.511 0.837 1.86 0.673
    >>>>>>> Stashed changes

    Remove NA if are present.

    predicted2 <- predicted
predicted2[sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), size = N, prob = c(1, 99), replace = TRUE)] <- NA

metrics(actual, predicted2)
<<<<<<< Updated upstream
#> 96 of 10000 'predicted' values are NAs, they will be ignorated
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>      ks   auc    iv  gini
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 0.506 0.827  1.73 0.655
    ======= #> 105 of 10000 'predicted' values are NAs, they will be ignorated #> # A tibble: 1 x 4 #> ks auc iv gini #> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0.512 0.830 1.84 0.661
    >>>>>>> Stashed changes

    Using a glm model

    daux <- data.frame(actual = actual, predicted = predicted)

m <- glm(actual ~ predicted, family = binomial, data = daux)

model_metrics(m)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>      ks   auc    iv  gini
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
<<<<<<< Updated upstream
#> 1 0.505 0.833  1.72 0.665
    ======= #> 1 0.511 0.837 1.84 0.673
    >>>>>>> Stashed changes

    Works with new data.

    new_daux <- head(daux, 1000)

model_metrics(m, newdata = new_daux)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>      ks   auc    iv  gini
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
<<<<<<< Updated upstream
#> 1 0.553 0.859  2.31 0.717
    ======= #> 1 0.508 0.836 2.02 0.672
    >>>>>>> Stashed changes
